title.narrative: PREVENT AND RESPOND TO HARMFUL PRACTICES AND VIOLENCE AGAINST GIRLS AND BOYS

description.narrative: Community members and leaders are better able to prevent and respond to harmful practices and violence against girls and boys within their communities., which contributes to Access To Justice, Harmful Practices (Fgm/C And Child Marriage), Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: CHILD PROTECTION outcome: Girls and boys vulnerable and exposed to violence, abuse and exploitation are better protected by institutional (formal and informal) and legislative frameworks which include services and systems.

related-activity.ref: 0060/A0/07/885 PROTECTION FROM ABUSE, VIOLENCE AND EXPL

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Community members and leaders are better able to prevent and respond to harmful practices and violence against girls and boys within their communities.

description.narrative: A total of 312,211 key influential community members including parents, elders, religious leaders, teachers and adolescents gained deeper understanding of the child's rights, child protection, gender norms and created collective community responses toward child protection. 112,540 adolescents (52 per cent girls) gained life skills and were empowered to be agents of positive change towards the abandonment of child marriage and violence against children. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:30/07/2020

title.narrative: Number of people who participate in social and behavior change communication interventions promoting elimination of VAC through UNICEF programmes
Number of individuals in programme areas who regularly participate in dialogues promoting gender equitable norms including delaying child marriage
